8 times the intentional walk went extremely wrong 8 times the intentional walk went extremely wrong By Andrew Joseph February 22, 2017 3:10 pm Follow @andyj0seph 716 shares 
The intentional walk as we know it is gone . 
On Wednesday, the MLB players’ association approved MLB’s request to allow managers to signal intentional walks from the dugout. This was all in an effort to improve the pace of play in baseball, but in the process, it took away one of baseball’s best sources of hilarious blunders. 
While many pitchers have no problem throwing a 95-mph fastball for a strike, it’s a totally different story when they’re asked to toss a catchable 65-mph pitch away from the plate. With the intentional walk gone, let’s take a look back at the bizarre moments that won’t be a thing anymore. 8. Miguel Cabrera turning an intentional walk into a hit 
It was the go-ahead single! 7. Intentionally walking Barry Bonds with the bases loaded 
The Diamondbacks voluntarily gave up a run rather than throw Barry Bonds a strike. 6. “So, they’re gonna walk Gary Sanchez.” Or not
